title: 114_hr1880
content: The Act is titled the "Albuquerque Indian School Land Transfer Act" and includes definitions for key terms. The Act defines "19 Pueblos" as the New Mexico Indian Pueblos and "map" as a specific map related to the Town of Albuquerque Grant. The curr_chunk refers to a land survey in New Mexico dated August 12, 2011, and defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior. Land taken into trust for benefit of 19 Pueblos. The Secretary will take into trust Federal land for the benefit of 19 Pueblos after meeting NEPA requirements. The Secretary will document the transfer and assign utility rights. The Federal land, totaling approximately 11.11 acres, was historically part of the Albuquerque Indian School and consists of 4 tracts described in detail. The Federal land in Albuquerque, New Mexico, totaling 3.69 acres, will be used for the educational, health, cultural, business, and economic development of the 19 Pueblos. The Secretary will conduct a survey and may make minor corrections as needed. The 19 Pueblos will allow the Bureau of Indian Affairs to use the land taken into trust for existing facilities without rental charge until the Secretary determines no further need. Federal land taken into trust under section 3(a) is subject to Federal laws relating to Indian land, with the exception that no class I, class II, or class III gaming can be carried out on the land.
